title: 115_hr4739
content:
The "Build America Act of 2018" is the short title of the Act. It establishes the National Infrastructure Investment Program. The "Build America Act of 2018" establishes a national infrastructure investment program for capital investments in surface transportation infrastructure. The Secretary of Transportation will distribute funds as discretionary grants for eligible projects including highway, bridge, and public transportation projects. The "Build America Act of 2018" establishes a national infrastructure investment program for surface transportation projects. The Secretary of Transportation can allocate funds for passenger and freight rail, port infrastructure, and other transportation projects. Up to 20% of funds can be used for subsidy and administrative costs. Funds will be distributed equitably across geographic areas, urban and rural needs, and various transportation modes. The Build America Act of 2018 establishes a national infrastructure investment program for surface transportation projects. The program ensures fair consideration for eligible projects and allocates grants ranging from $5,000,000 to $45,000,000. Not more than 10% of funds can be awarded to projects in a single state, and the federal share of costs can be up to 80%. Priority projects will be determined by the Secretary. The Secretary will prioritize projects needing federal funds to complete financing. At least 20% of funds will go to rural projects, with a minimum grant size of $1,000,000. The federal share of costs can exceed 80%. Projects must adhere to wage rate requirements. The Secretary conducts annual competitions to select projects for grants and credit assistance under the program. Up to $25,000,000 can be retained for administrative expenses, and funds for the program remain available for obligation. The program funds must be used within 3 years, any unspent funds will be transferred to the Highway Trust Fund. $3 billion is available annually from the National Infrastructure Investment Trust Fund for the program. SEC. 3. FIXED GUIDEWAY CAPITAL INVESTMENT GRANTS. Funding of $9 billion annually from the Fixed Guideway Capital Investment Trust Fund for the Secretary of Transportation to carry out section 5309 of title 49, United States Code. The Secretary may retain up to 1% for administrative expenses. Funds are available for 4 years for obligation under that section. The funds allocated for section 5309 of title 49, United States Code must be used within 4 years, or unobligated amounts will be transferred to the Highway Trust Fund. SEC. 4. ESTABLISHMENT OF TRUST FUNDS. Amends the Internal Revenue Code to establish the National Infrastructure Investment Trust Fund. The National Infrastructure Investment Trust Fund is created in the Treasury of the United States, funded by appropriated amounts equivalent to certain taxes. Expenditures from the fund are authorized. The National Infrastructure Investment Trust Fund is funded by appropriated amounts and available to the Secretary of Transportation for the national infrastructure investment program under the Build America Act of 2018. SEC. 9513. FIXED GUIDEWAY CAPITAL INVESTMENT TRUST FUND. Establishment of the Fixed Guideway Capital Investment Trust Fund in the Treasury of the United States, funded by appropriations and credits. Appropriation of 25 percent of certain taxes to the Trust Fund, related to specific clauses and amendments under the Build America Act of 2018. The America Act of 2018 specifies taxes received under sections 4041 and 4081 without reduction for credits under section 6426. Amounts in the Fixed Guideway Capital Investment Trust Fund are available to the Secretary of Transportation for expenditures under section 5309 of title 49, United States Code. A clerical amendment is made to the Internal Revenue Code of 1986. SEC. 5. INCREASE IN TAX ON CIGARETTES AND SMALL CIGARS. The tax on small cigars and cigarettes is increased in the Internal Revenue Code of 1986. Small cigars will now be taxed at $75.30 per thousand, and cigarettes will be taxed at $75.30 per thousand for paragraph (1) and $130.69 per thousand for paragraph (2).

SEC. 6. INCREASE IN TAX ON MOTOR FUELS. The tax on motor fuels is increased. The Internal Revenue Code of 1986 is amended to increase taxes on gasoline and diesel fuel. Gasoline tax is increased from 18.3 cents to 53.3 cents, and diesel fuel tax is increased from 24.3 cents to 59.3 cents. Additionally, there will be an adjustment for inflation starting in 2018. The tax rates for gasoline and diesel fuel are increased, with gasoline tax going from 18.3 cents to 53.3 cents and diesel fuel tax from 24.3 cents to 59.3 cents. There will also be an adjustment for inflation starting in 2018. The amendments made by this section will apply to fuels removed, entered, or sold after October 1, 2018. The Highway Trust Fund will see an increase in gasoline and diesel fuel tax rates, with adjustments for inflation starting in 2018. These changes will apply to fuels removed, entered, or sold after October 1, 2018. The Internal Revenue Code of 1986 is amended to adjust the Mass Transit Portion and transfer unobligated National Infrastructure Investment and Fixed Guideway Capital Investment amounts. Fixed Guideway Capital Investment Amounts are amended by appropriating amounts to be transferred to the Highway Trust Fund under the Build America Act of 2018. Additionally, a portion of these amounts will be transferred to the Mass Transit Account based on the mass transit portion ratio defined in subsection (e)(2). Taxes on fuel deposited into the Highway Trust Fund under sections 4041 and 4081.
